item.title: Digital Humanities Workshops
item.description: Since the Spring 2018 semester I have served as the Digital Humanities Graduate Specialist for Rutgers Libraries. Over the course of that time I’ve developed a number of workshops, from basic tutorials on using software popular among digital humanists (Gephi, Paladio, Tropy, etc.) to some introductory and even intermediate lessons on R programming in the humanities. Most of this material - code, printouts, and sample data - can be found on my GitHub page.
